5.0 New outlets for an existing brand

definitions.cuisine_tags: Visible on restaurant card; up to 3; integrated in tiles, carousels, and search
definitions.tag_tags: Hidden search/sorting tags for key menu items
definitions.subpage_tags: Hidden tags tied to subpages/subtiles for sorting within sections

onboarding_general: Sales attaches MIF file with cuisines/tags; review tags tree

rules: Should reflect 50% of the menu or main value proposition

Up to 3 cuisine tags; Cuisine Tag 3 is optional (0 or 1)
Cuisine Tag 3 must come from corresponding Food/General tags for the chosen G1/G2 OR from the non‑geographical cuisine list
If MIF provides 2 G1 tags from the same tree, apply both plus G2
Do not mix different G1s from different G2s; do not mix food items from unrelated geographical cuisines
Do not use non‑geographical cuisine tags for Healthy/Desserts
Cuisine tags can be replicated into tag tags

roles.Sales: Raise onboarding ticket; attach MIF with tags & cuisine
roles.AM: Raise/update tickets; cannot directly change tags; submit suggestions via ticket
roles.QC: Add new tags; review Catalog tags; modify to ensure standards

governance: QC lead exports lists by category (e.g., Sandwiches, Burgers) for Catalog review
Catalog marks correct outlets; suggests changes for incorrect ones
QC reviews proposals: approve for Catalog to implement or return with required changes
